column5: I'm sitting here in Hong Kong on a lay over waiting to fly back to Canada after 4 days in Taipei, Taiwan. It felt like 4 weeks. So next time I'm out on my boat, standing on a frozen lake or anywhere I can stand further than arms length away from another person and breath fresh air, I'm going to remember this week and sing a few lines of Oh Canada!!! We are so blessed.
You know what they say, home is where the heart is!  We live in the best, land for land and coast to coast, in the world.  -Sawyer
I hear you! Even a flight to Toronto then Thunder Bay gets me all cranky. There's nothing like the quiet, open and uncontaminated outdoors.
Thats a long way from home bud  Did ya take a wrong turn in albuquerque?
Canada is not from coast to coast. Canada is from coast to coast to coast. We have three, you see.
You,my friend, are a vast cornucopia of information
Many years ago I did a lot of traveling with a company. I enjoyed getting away but always loved arriving back home. I sure gave me an appreciation of my home Canada.
What is a "cornucopia"?  Is it a good bait for walleye?
Yup, and I've been to all three! Love this place. I don't have my passport and I have no intention of applying for it

we have everything here !!!! no need to ever go anywhere,there is no country on this earth that can even compare to ours !!!! i will never own a passport either,and not too mention the best fishing in the world.....
Yeah, and we'll have another one as soon as we annex that bunch down south. The 'fifth columns' in Florida and Hollywood are well placed, it's just a matter of time...

Update! In TO and couldn't be happier! That fresh cool air is amazing. Yeah FRESH! Toronto is the garden of Eden in comparison!! Might just light the BBQ, crack a beer and enjoy the backyard Canadian style!!! Good to be home...
Ah, could be three from tree to tree, or one long one according to Dr. Derring's Singing Herrings said he.  (tgif)
